name: Color Coherence Vector
description: Differentiates spatially coherent vs. incoherent color distribution. AI images tend to have unnaturally high color coherence in regions.
mechanism: Classifies each pixel as coherent or incoherent based on connected component membership relative to region size threshold. Computes ratio between coherent and incoherent pixels per color bin.
parameters: Color quantization: 64 bins, Coherence threshold: 25 pixels, Connected components: 4-connectivity
source: Pass, G. et al. (1996) — Histogram Refinement for Content-Based Image Retrieval, ACM MM Workshop
useCase: Detecting overly uniform color regions in AI-generated images

references.title: Pass, G. et al. (1996). Histogram Refinement for Content-Based Image Retrieval. ACM Multimedia Workshop.
